MAPFbench¶

MAPFBench is a simple tool that simplifies the benchmarking of algorithms’ implementations for the Multi Agent Path Finding (MAPF) problem.

The project as been developed as assignment for the Progetto di Ingegneria Informatica (5 CFU) at Politecnico di Milano, under the supervision of professors Francesco Amigoni and Maria Grazia Fugini.

Features¶

  • Possibility to define scenarios both in graphs and grid maps

  • Multiple iterations of the same scenarios

  • Check of vertex and edge conflicts for submitted plans

  • Calculation of indices and aggregate metrics for tests and multiple iterations of the same test

  • Import and export of benchmarks and results as human-readable files

Limitations¶

  • Currently, the tool supports Python programs only
